intro: Carrierea rehderiana, commonly known as the Rehder's carrierea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed, contributing to its use in traditional herbal medicine.
